thread.title: Hildebrand tallies shutout as MSU tops LSSU, 2-0
thread.title_full: Hildebrand tallies shutout as MSU tops LSSU, 2-0

title: Hildebrand tallies shutout as MSU tops LSSU, 2-0
text:
Hildebrand tallies shutout as MSU tops LSSU, 2-0 Lansing State Journal 9:30 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Buy Photo Jake Hildebrand (Photo: Kevin W. Fowler | For the Lansing State Journal) Buy Photo 
EAST LANSING - Jake Hildebrand made 21 saves while JT Stenglein and Thomas Ebbing both scored as the Michigan State hockey team (2-3-1) defeated Lake Superior State, 2-0, on Friday night at Munn Arena. The shutout was the 11th of Hildebrandâ€™s career. 
Stenglein got the Spartans on the board with 20 seconds remaining in the opening period, beating Laker goaltender Nick Kossoff with a nice move in close for his third goal of the season. 
The Spartans struck again late in the next period as Ebbing just got a piece of a Rhett Holland point shot and tipped it past Kossoff to make it 2-0 with 1:12 to play in the second. 
The Spartans will be off next weekend and will return to action at home, Nov. 6-7, against New Hampshire.
